name: Sadagaat
mission: Sadagaat seeks to contribute to improving the educational services of the poor segments by focusing on the education of special groups (children who are not enrolled in schools and the blind), in addition to improving the educational environment, building the capacities of the educational staff, and providing opportunities for professional education.
theoryOfChange: Empowering marginalized communities through a combination of immediate emergency relief (food/water) and sustainable development (education/infrastructure) to break the cycle of poverty.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat (Source: https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 97.5/100 score and maintains a 98.4% program expense ratio.
SADAGAAT-USA is Zakat-eligible and follows specific Zakat policies and asnaf categories.
Total revenue for the period was $1,294,453 with a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
The organization focuses on education for special groups and improving educational services for the poor.
SADAGAAT-USA is a registered entity in good standing operating humanitarian programs.
The charity operates programs in the Health Care, Feeding, Water, and Education sectors.
The charity provides multiple giving methods including Zakat and general donations.
The organization engages volunteers to support its mission and community outreach.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SADAGAAT-USA earns a strong overall rating due to its superior financial efficiency and high transparency, evidenced by a 97.97.5/100 from Charity Navigator score. Its direct impact model and Zakat eligibility make it a highly aligned choice for Muslim donors.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital reserves of 3.6 months, which may impact long-term sustainability during economic shifts.
Reliance on direct provision models which require continuous high-volume funding to maintain impact.

dimension_explanations.alignment: SADAGAAT-USA shows high alignment for donors seeking to fulfill religious obligations, as it is Zakat-eligible and maintains a dedicated Zakat policy [2][7]. The organization's focus on domestic poverty and urgent humanitarian needs in the education and health sectors reflects a high cause urgency [4][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, maintaining a 98.4% program expense ratio and a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 [1][3]. With total revenue of $1,294,453, the charity focuses on tangible outcomes such as building educational capacity and providing clean water access [4][6].

baseline_narrative.headline: SADAGAAT-USA provides essential humanitarian aid through high-efficiency programs in health, water, and education for vulnerable populations.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.4%, ensuring nearly all funds reach beneficiaries.
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised.
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for asnaf categories.
baseline_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving educational services for marginalized groups, including children not enrolled in school and the visually impaired [4][6]. The organization operates across four primary sectors—Health Care, Feeding, Water, and Education—to alleviate poverty and enhance community infrastructure [4][5].

alignment.improvement: Alignment could be enhanced by <cite id="1">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited existing nonprofit coverage.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could move from a developing to a <cite id="1">fully documented theory of change</cite>.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize extreme financial efficiency and want their zakat to directly fund humanitarian infrastructure in Sudan.
donor_motivations: Want 100% of their donation to reach the field
Care about the humanitarian crisis and educational gaps in Sudan
Value high-transparency ratings from third-party evaluators
Seek to fulfill zakat through verified asnaf categories
giving_considerations: The organization is highly efficient but still developing its long-term impact reporting
Focus is heavily concentrated on Sudan, which has high operational risks
Excellent for donors who prefer lean, direct-action charities over large bureaucracies
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking large-scale advocacy work or those who require rigorous RCT-level evidence of long-term educational outcomes.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while <cite id="1">3 outcome metrics are tracked</cite>, comprehensive cost-effectiveness data is not yet public.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization aims to combat the 'Poverty-Ignorance-Disease' cycle by providing <cite id="1">direct services in water, health, and education</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Consistent impact data ensures that the 100% program ratio translates into the highest possible quality of life improvements.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="3">33.4% revenue CAGR</cite> and massive humanitarian needs in Sudan, the org has high capacity to absorb new funds.
strategic_priorities: Combatting poverty, ignorance, and disease in Sudan

strengths.detail: The organization directs a <cite id="1">98.4% program expense ratio</cite> toward its mission, significantly exceeding the <cite id="1">peer program ratio median of 89.8%</cite>.
SADAGAAT-USA holds a <cite id="1">97.5/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned the Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency.
The charity is <cite id="2">verified Zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the <cite id="2">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> asnaf categories.

strengths_deep_dive: SADAGAAT-USA's operational model is characterized by an aggressive focus on direct service delivery. Their <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite> is among the highest in the humanitarian sector, allowing them to maximize the impact of small and large donations alike. This is supported by a <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>, ensuring strong oversight and objective governance. Furthermore, the organization maintains <cite id="1">3.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a resilient financial cushion that allows for sustained operations even during donor fluctuations.
rich_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating poverty and improving infrastructure for vulnerable populations, primarily in Sudan. The organization operates with a lean model, reporting <cite id="3">$1,294,453 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Their operations are categorized into five critical sectors: <cite id="4">Feeding, Water, Health, Education, and Crisis Relief</cite>. A defining characteristic of the charity is its extreme financial efficiency; it maintains a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 98.4%</cite>, ensuring that every dollar donated is directed toward service delivery rather than administrative overhead. This efficiency is further evidenced by their fundraising operations, which cost only <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. The charity has demonstrated significant growth, achieving a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 33.4%</cite>, reflecting increasing donor trust and operational scaling. Beyond financial metrics, SADAGAAT-USA holds a <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, bolstered by perfect scores of 100 in both Culture and Leadership beacons. Their mission focuses on <cite id="4">improving educational services for the poor</cite>, specifically targeting children not enrolled in schools and the visually impaired, while simultaneously addressing immediate survival needs through water and health projects.
